thread.title: The Wall Street Journal: Deutsche Bank shuts Houston office, cuts around 70 jobs

title: The Wall Street Journal: Deutsche Bank shuts Houston office, cuts around 70 jobs
text:
12:18 p.m. ET Share
Under new CEO Christian Sewing, the German lender is cutting investment-banking staff to reduce costs Getty Images
By Jenny Strasburg
Deutsche Bank AG will close its Houston office and cut around 70 U.S. investment-banking jobs primarily focused on advising oil and gas companies, according to people familiar with the matter and an internal memo to employees.
Mark Fedorcik, head of Americas corporate finance for the German lender DB, +1.30% , told employees the move would “rationalize our U.S. oil and gas investment-banking coverage footprint,” according to a memo sent internally late Thursday and viewed by The Wall Street Journal.
A Deutsche Bank spokeswoman confirmed the contents of the memo.
